intro: Acinodendron mellinum, commonly known as the white-flowered acinodendron, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Rhamnaceae and is characterized by its shrub-like growth habit. The plant produces small, white flowers that are clustered in inflorescences, which are often borne on short, hairy peduncles. Its leaves are alternate, simple, and have a rough texture with a distinctive glandular appearance. Acinodendron mellinum is typically found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments.
